conversation.speaker: Patient
conversation.text: I've been feeling so overwhelmed lately, like I'm constantly underwater and can't catch my breath.

conversation.speaker: Therapist
conversation.text: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy burden right now, and the pressure feels almost suffocating, making it hard to find a moment of peace.

conversation.speaker: Patient
conversation.text: Exactly. And every time I try to talk to my boss about it, I just freeze up.

conversation.speaker: Therapist
conversation.text: So even though you know you need to speak up to change things, there's a part of you that feels paralyzed when it comes time to actually advocate for yourself.

conversation.speaker: Patient
conversation.text: Yeah, I'm just afraid I'll look weak or incompetent.

conversation.speaker: Therapist
conversation.text: You're worried that showing any sign of struggle will lead others to judge you or doubt your abilities.
